I have had the OP One for almost 3 years and my wife has an identical OP One (64GB) for about 2.5 years and have not had any issues at all.  I have just upgraded my OS to Oreo (Android 8.0- LineageOS 15) and my wife's phone is on LineageOS 13 (Android 6).  I am running the latest Android OS available on a 3 year old phone with no issues.  How many people can say that with their phones?  My battery charges rapidly and lasts for a couple of days.  I could not be happier with my purchases of the OnePlus One.  I'm sure their later models are great too, but I don't have any need to change as it was so powerful to begin with.

Probably the worst in product quality and customer support, the OnePlusOne phone I have has some issues with insulation (and I have read about such experiences from other unfortunate users as well), after a few months of using the phone I observed that dust was entering the phone camera, I took the device to the service center (Bangalore - India) they cleaned it and gave it back, within a few months again I observed the same issues, took it again to the service center they cleaned the dust again and told me there is some issue with the phone and asked me to contact the "Call Center" as they cant do anything about it. I promptly called the "Call Center", the agent asked me to visit the "service center" again, I did that and as expected the service center washed their hands saying I need to go call the "Call Center". Tried reaching out to different email IDs, support phone numbers etc etc and every time I was assigned a new ticket and nothing happened beyond that, I even wrote to the CEO with all the details and again received a service ticket without any resolution of the manufacturing defect. I dont think anybody even reads customer emails in OnePlus One, if even the CEO is not bothered how can we expect the call center and service center agents to have empathy for the customer. And all this when they sold a defective device to me, I am stuck with a faulty phone, and all the organization is doing is pushing me around between their multiple teams so that I get tired of this exercise and give up.........
 
Very well done OnePlus, I am not going to fall for any of your products in future.

I m using this phone since last 2 years. so many rom I installed on this device. best was lineage 14 (android 7),CM14, currently I m using MIUI 8 best so far. working like charm. good battery backup, super user interface. dual apps function working properly. thumbs up for OPO.

does a great job. Quick in most apps. Moved from Iphone to android and ths is my second android. Impressed! 
Bought 2 for my business. Dropped it many times. Frame seems strong but the on/off button is weak. 
Love the no interruptions button.  
Glass or frame never broke in bad impacts.  Dropped my Iphone once and shattered in the same fall. One+ never noticed it. Dropped many times.   
Down side.... 
Both the phones hang up badly on you tube or similar vids. 
Sound is not great. Hardly hear much on loud speaker. 
Casing is thin and will slip out your hand easily. Make sure its in a thick case. 
Cant remove battery normally. (But ways round this!) 
Both my phones have poor quality video recording but great pics. 
They had so many apps that 'seek attention' that they will send you mad! Clean me! Optimise me! Battery low! All making noises non stop! 
Try to delete them, they will load themselves back up on the next data access. More like a virus! 
I flashed them in the end and cleaned them out. Now work perfectly and battery lasts twice as long. 
I would recommend this to anyone though.

Best phone I've ever owned. Rooted and running Cyanogen 13.1.2, Android 6.0.1, it's as fast and reliable as the day I bought it around 18 months ago. I use it for a lot of things I once needed a computer for. My only gripes are that the battery isn't accessible and the camera isn't the best in dark environments (excellent otherwise) but cruising on Marshmallow and Cyanogen makes it customizable in just about every way. Treat it well and it will last and serve you well for a long time. With unofficial Android 7.0 ROMs starting to do the rounds I see no reason to upgrade it. I watch 3D movies using it in a VR headset, play 360 VR games, have 200+ apps installed, and it feels and looks great. The battery not being accessible hasn't been problematic yet but ultimately one day I'll need to replace it so that's the only real downside for me - I don't know why so many manufacturers do this. But other than that an all round great piece of kit. 9/10

I recently traded by Nokia Lumia 1520 for the Oneplus One and since then there has been no looking back the phone works stutter free, after the windows 10 update the Nokia Lumia 1520 stutter a lot, with a few drop in frames while play graphic intensive games and apps crash  more often and the phone tends to slow down. Since my exchange program, I've loved the Oneplus One (I used to criticise the device and the OS earlier) but, after using it for more than 2 months I can't seem to get over it, the os is smooth with the cyanogen Mod 13 (Marshmallow update) game playing is awesome, more app choices for Android but, lot of bloat ware on the playstore as well so you have to be careful. Thanks to the 3GB Ram the phone handles multi-tasking with absolutely no slowdowns or stutters. 
 
The only con is the google voice assist doesn't work at all when the screen is turned off, I travel a lot by road, and I hate using my phone while driving my car and I noticed I had to stop my vehicle a few times to do some basic exercises to make use of the calls and accessing whatsapp or even skype for that matter, I miss the cortana integration that Windows phone has to offer, having said that the new marshmallow update for cyanogen does support few Microsoft based apps like Cortana, trending twitter topics on the lock screen and few other features which I haven't used. But,  I've noticed that Cortana doesn't work as smoothly as it does on windows phone when the screen is turned off, and in many asian countries voice activation for cortana isn't available for Android yet. The second issue i've noticed is the phone tends to slow down with some basic apps like trying to dial a # the phone just takes more than just a few seconds to dial a # from the contact history, the same holds true even while adding a contact to your address book. Not sure if its just my device or other oneplus One owners who have upgraded are facing similar app loadup time slowdowns. 
 
Other wise the phone works perfectly fine and i'm quite satisfied with it.

Worst every customer service I have experienced.

There are two version for Redmi Note 3, Meditek or Snapdragon, the Snapdragon 650 version certainly is the better one. 
Guarantee or not, only the user who really use it can answer. 
I do own it, and it certainly a very good. It do not has an apps drawer, but it simply not a big deal, all apps and using experience still remain very "Android", which fully remain high customization level, and high level of freedom on usage, especially on media playback. I do compare it with other phone with apps drawer, and I start feeling the apps drawer is redundant. The only advantage to have apps drawer is being able to hide apps, but no more. 
It isn't fair to compare to Z3 or Oneplus One, but it certainly offer performance that comparable to those, with a cheaper price, almost half the price to own one, and a very usable one without all the lagginess and stutter found on most cheap Android phone. It even run games on full frame rate on highest graphic setting without issue.  
Not bashing saying other phone is worse or trying to praising the Xiaomi phone, but it is a solid choice to own one, given the budget, as the RN3 is much cheaper than the Oneplus One, even much cheaper than Oneplus X in my country, so really worth the consideration. The Snapdragon's RN3 even comes with Micro SD slot, finger print scanner and IR blaster, so it really provide much more value for owning than Oneplus One and Z3. 
But do remember, only the Xiaomi global rom is more stable, others not recommended, even though there maybe some performance boost. Coming from a user who use it day by day.

I've done a little researching on this, I don't have this issue but a lot of people seem to have the same or similar. 
A majority of the response say it's an Android error, which I don't necessarily agree with but it's very possible there's a conflict between Android and Cyanogen. 
A more likely reason however is there's a setting somewhere that is limiting the sounds. Seeing as you get vibration/screen on.  
A couple of things to try/check. 
Double check all your volumes (ring, notification, alarm) are turned up.  
Try a different launcher. (Next 3D is a personal favourite) 
Disable any lock screen for a while. 
Worst case scenario - factory reset.

7 days ago, my oneplus one wouldn't turn on. It was fully charged but no sign of starting. I contacted Support, and went through a rigmarole with some helpful person, who could only ask was it fully charged, then that I should back it up fully. (Why have someone with so little skill here I don't know, though she was very helpful, it would have been better to have someone more knowledgeable). She upgraded the issue to the next level and suggested I make an appointment for an online review, (incidentally I did that and it is arranged for 2 days time). She gave me a series of files to download in advance. I was insistent about the urgency and she got someone to speak to me almost immediately. 
So i opened a real time session with the next guy, and as soon as i say i'm using a macbook, he backs off. Says it must be returned to them. It seems they could have restarted it remotely if i had a windows pc. Note one of the files I downloaded seemed to be a driver to allow an apple pc to talk through a USB port to the phone. This guy never mentioned that! 
Anyway, the next i get is a voucher and address label for the phone to be sent back by DHL. The address on the label is in Germany! I'm in England! So 2 days later DHL show up and pick up the phone! 
I'm here 5 days later having been told just now it takes 5 to 7 days to process it for repair. Remember they told me it could be fixed online in 45 minutes! So I've had no phone for a week, my business is dependent on a phone, and i haven't talked to my kids in 10 days (they live in another country). 
Now I love the phone. Its easy use, and has a great screen. I cannot give a technical review like others here but I like it, especially the price. Except for: 
The pain I had transferring data from an iphone and the convenient links to my macbook.  
Contacts: Some of my contacts didn't transfer. The phone wants to search google rather than the address book. So if I'm roaming, I cannot get some of my contacts. Inconvenient to say the least! 
Photos: My photos don't automatically go to my laptop anymore! Some of my stored photos on my laptop have disappeared. I use Viber a lot. I get photos on Viber but cannot upload to my macbook. 
Music: I use iTunes, I don't buy much music, and never online downloads. One of the problems i had with my iphone was that lack of storage for music. It was an iphone 4 and could only handle 100 to 125 songs. Not great out of my library of 7500. So I thought i would be able to get them onto my oneplus. I'm not sure, I think it's playing my music from my library but over the internet. I cannot see what's on the phone as it doesn't link to my macbook! 
Support: Well I read about poor support but I liked the price enough to gamble on a new oneplus. 
Well you've seen the story above. Am I happy? no! My biggest problem is not knowing what is happening or when and if I'll get my phone back.  
My advice to potential buyers, is to consider the lack of linkage to macbook before mixing technology!

Pros: It's a very good phone specification and price wise. 
Cons: 
None of the official ROM is good. Cyanogen has issues: call quality and autofocus in video recording. OxygenOS has very less features like cannot change screen temp etc. (There is a custom kernel but has slow charge and heat issues) 
Even for custom ROM you have to root for some reason or other. Learning curve is there. 
Yellow tint issue is there at bottom part of screen for many phones. (can be ignored with 4500K (R-255, G-218, B-187) screen temp)
 
Conclusion: After much hit and try with ROMs I am now set with SAOSP (A custom AOSP based Marshmallow 6.0.1 ROM) with starostarno kernel. Now there is no issue in call quality and camera. Battery life has improved and no heating issues at all.

Using the device since march 2015. It is a gem of a product. I see new phones being launched every week I still cant find something as good as what I have. One important thing I wanted to share is that If you like a phone just go for it. You cant say which phone will have heating problems. It entirely depends on your luck...

Phone will get warm/hot when charging. This is not a problem. If battery is really low this is because phone is switching between fast/slow charging cycles and finally to trickle charge for last 20-30 minutes. This insures complete, full charge. 
Personally I have found putting phone on charger every night, lessened the heating problem. Battery will stop charging when full charge is reached. So I unpluug in morning. I get full time usage from battery, over a year now... OK?

Hello Friends, 
Namaste! from India. 
The most common problem of OnePlus One is the call and voice quality related problem. Everyone (mostly the people who updated the phone to the latest software update) who has purchased this phone. Well definitely this is a bug in Cyanogenmod OS where the 3rd Noise cancellation MIC [located near the camera] overreacts ;) to any kind of noise( including your voice) it captures and try to minimizes it. This results in call & voice breaks. The algorithm written for Noise cancellation using the 3 MICs is not working properly. And frankly speaking CM team is struggling to fix this.
 
So, for the time-being people who are facing this issue can make use of any of the following methods to fix this issue: 
1) Paste a tape over the 3rd Mic [located near camera] and cover it completely [Or] 
2) Uninstall any Call recorder software that you have installed [And] 
3) Disable "Ok Google" voice detection in Google Settings ->Search & Now-> Voice->"Ok Google" detection -> Disable all the 3 options
 
The method 2&3 worked for me and lot of other people too. Disabling of call recorder & Ok Google solves the issue because both these apps depend on MICs to capture the voice and when MIC is used, the buggy Noise cancellation algorithm kicks in and hence the problem starts.
 
So, people who think its a Hardware or Phone problem, please relax and enjoy your 1+1 as this is a SW problem and u can fix it using the above tweaks.
 
Keep smiling. bye :)

When we talk about battery , it has a pretty good battery. Well if you are a heavy user of your phone this will not give you any miracle. But if you are a moderate user you will be stunned by the performance of oneplus one. Well iam getting around 6 hours of onscreen time. Let me tell you the standby time of this phone is mind blowing. If you have 100 percent charge at  night and when you woke up without using the phone it shows around 98 % battery. 
So guys this is my first review after couple of weeks use. I need some more time  to give any further reviews on my oneplus one.thankyou for helping me to choose this beast.

Hello,
 
I must be the only person who has thrown the oneplus 1 in the bin. Yes the high end operating specs are great but the basics of the phone are poor.
 
1. Signal strength: Poor. Inside the house, in the same location the other 4 family phones reception is either full strength or 4 bars. Oneplus 1.... 1 bar. The phones are a Samsung note 2, samsung s5, apple 5 and htc m8.
 
2. When the sim is inserted in the 1 it loses over 25% of the contacts, but insert the same sim in any of the other 4 phones all sim contacts show.
 
3. Gallery: Try and do another folder so you can seperate ur pics. Also no ability to have hidden folders.
 
4.  Ringtones: will not let u use downloaded ringtones as ur primary ringtone or as a sim contact.
 
To me the basics are as important as the high end especially signal strength.
 
Thanks.

I've owned this phone for six months. First month was mainly problem free and it all went down hill from there.  I now can't use this phone with a head set because it disconnects upon receiving a call. At random times the phone will just go into possessed ghost mode where the number 4 will be pressed for minutes relentlessly during which time the phone cannot be used.  It has a difficult time holding a WiFi connection in my house as opposed to our other phones and devices and will only work on WiFi in some areas. The call quality is worse than any of my other phones although marginally acceptable. The phone also has a tendency to freeze often. The good sides are that battery life is great and its cheap, but I guess you get what you pay for. I switched to this phone from an iPhone 4s and will be sticking to iphone or something else from.now on. I would NOT recommend this phone to a friend,,even with that attractive price tag.

I've been considering one of these to replace my Galaxy Nexus, but was worried about some of the negative reviews. Last night I found out that a colleague had owned one since November 2014, and I had the opportunity to evaluate it briefly and to get feedback from her. She also used the phone alongside her 2 year old iphone.
 
Even though it has been dropped and there is a small crack in the side, the phone continues to function without fault. She has had no problems with crashing and hanging.
 
I noticed it was really quick through the menu's and the UI was well thought out and easy to use.
 
Whilst it is true the phone didn't (only just) have the same feel of quality that my Nexus 4 has, it was certainly adequate.
 
Her only complaint was that the photo quality didn't quite match her iphone.
 
My opinion? I would buy, for the price the specs are hard to beat. Hope this helps those sitting on the fence.

Have you tried completely formatting the memory and reload the OS?
 
There have been reports of corrupt OS image and/or bad clusters in the memory that results in your described symptoms.
 
I had problems with frozen blank screen on wake from lock. I completely formatted the memory and reloaded stock CM 11s (44S). Since doing that, I did not have any problems until I upgraded to CM 11s (05Q). I then reformatted and reloaded stock 44S and it is again working well.
 
If you want to make your OPO more stable, check out their forums for instructions to format and reinstall.
 
Cheers

@Akshaymsabu
 
I have both phones. Both are very good phones. My wife uses the Nexus 5. I use the OPO. The build quality of the OPO is subjectively better. The battery life of the OPO is better. The OPO is faster. CM 11S has far more customizations than stock Android in the Nexus 5. The resulting pictures from the OPO camera are better.
 
Nexus 5 size is easier to handle. The OPO is essentially a phablet. I prefer carrying my phone in a holster. Any holsters that fit the OPO is ridiculously large. 
 
Cheers

Nexus 5 is little pricey compared to OPO. Choose on what your needs are:
 
I would choose Nexus 5 over OPO for: 
1) Regular and faster OS updates OTA  (this is a BIG thing for many) 
2) Vanilla Android (and this too) 
3) Barometer sensor
 
I would choose OPO over Nexus 5 for: 
1) Ultimate number of customizations you can do with your phone 
2) The best thing for me is, I can change font without rooting and other gimmicks 
3) Slightly bigger and hence makes sense for FHD reading (5.5 vs 4.95 inches) 
4) Slightly faster processor clock speed (2.5GHz vs 2.3GHz Quad-core  Krait 400) 
5) Better onboard memory (64GB vs 32GB) 
6) Higher RAM (3GB vs 2GB)

Hello. I have been fortunate enough to get two invites for the OP One. I have purchased two of the 64 GB versions, one for my wife and one for myself. We are well pleased with all aspects of this model. We are in the U.S. and I have read some of the problems some people have written concerning this phone. We have had nothing but great experience using them. We have no working relationship with either hardware or software makers of this phone. We are just happy consumers using T-Mobile pay as you go. Very happy with the camera which has many settings and ISO of up to 1600. You can even take time lapse movies which I have been interested in doing for a long time but with no device to do so. Sorry. I can find no downside with this device. It has received OTA updates and we anticipate a new update to (CM12) Lollipop in the not too distant future. Flagship killer indeed!

Wonderful phone with high end specs! Very functional in both hardware and software departments. The only problem I have so far was the Bluetooth not working after the XNPH05Q upgrade. There is a fix out there by either downgrading the stock rom or with rooted images.

I would highly recommend against purchasing the Oneplus One. I must have been sent a faulty phone, because I've had mine since September 2014 and for the past five months it's barely functioned. It crashes constantly, every second or third time I turn it on. The screen just goes black and it won't start working again until I manually restart the phone. Additionally I have heating issues and the battery doesn't last that long. The phone takes between 5-30 seconds to respond when pressing the lock button to turn the screen on, and quite often when playing audio it will crash and stop, even if it's an mp3 file. 
 
Like I said, I'm sure that I've just been sent a faulty device, but I know two other people with a Oneplus One and one of them is having difficulties with their phone as well. Oneplus One's tech support is frustrating and unhelpful, they haven't even responded to one of my tickets. All in all my Oneplus One has been the most frustrating piece of technology I've ever owned and I would recommend anyone to not buy it. Maybe if you choose to buy it you'll get lucky and yours will work great, but it seems to be a gamble. A gamble which has cost me 400$.

Using this for the past 2 weeks now. Absolutely no problems. I have had no heating issues. But remember one thing - Even on my Nexus 7 there is a mild heating when you play games for a long duration. Thats obvious because of the CPU/GPU push you are doing (in PCs you have fans to cool off).
 
For me the battery lasts nearly 2 days. My usage - atleast 30mins gaming (on moderately demanding games like GT Racing 2, real racing, Hill Climb racing) + All day Wifi + 3G, about 30-60mins of calls / texting and other routine usages.
 
I did not face any crashes with the built in apps so far (touch wood).
 
Yes, they do not provide headphones and I am cool with it (if you have interest in listening to good music you must have had one by now, anyways).
 
I loved the simplicity of the phone UI and the extent to which one can use the customizations to their needs.
 
People say not having Lollipop version is -ve. I beg to differ. As I said I have Nexus 7 and I have used Android 5. Except for few UI gimmicks, I dont miss 5.0 at all on my OPO. But I only wished they had an option to not get preinstalled with all google apps like newstand, movies, games and what not. I cant seem to uninstall them (I can disable though).
 
With the specs and performance on this phone, trust me you can be safe for atleast next 2 years.

I've had the OnePlus for four months now and am one of the MANY users who had the unfortunate experience of coming across the "ghost touches" issue.  It happens a few months after owning, where your phone begins to register touches where there are none.
 
OnePlus acknowledges this issue and posts patches every so often in an attempt to fix it, but they have not, since the issue was reported in July of 2014, resolved the issue.  This is because it is not fixable through software.  It is a hardware issue that the company refuses to acknowledge, because then they'd have to deal with mass recalling and refunding of their product, which they cannot afford to do as a new, unestablished company.
 
Efforts to return the phone instead get forwarded to their support team who tell you to wait for a fix or offer patches which do nothing to resolve the issue.  They're trying their best not to give you their money back for a defective product, and it's been incredibly frustrating dealing with both the issue and their support team.
 
I do not recommend OnePlus to anyone.  They found a way to undercut other companies and that's by skimping on a proper testing process and support team.

Just to share some experience after using it about 2 week. (Bought in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia) price around RM 1305.00 (After searching several stores because not all dealer are selling this phone at the moment)
 
1) Great camera (both picture & videos) 
2) Clear & loud sound speaker (at the bottom).  
3) I keep downloading many games (total about 32 and still going, average MB per games around 100MB to 300MB or more) and play some of the games and there is no lagging or heating whatsoever on the phone. The battery are draining slow and still can play 7-8 hours non stop (offline). IF you are playing games that require internet connection it might do around 6++ hours or so. (Depend of what kind of games you are enjoying.) 
5) Smooth & fast devices. The phone showing much more faster when you taping any apps in the phone. It take less second to load. Sames goes when surfing the internet or youtube.  
6) With 64gig on the phone memory, imagine how many apps, games, videos, song or picture that can be fit into it WITHOUT any problem. 
7) I did some comparation to others 3gig ram phone brand and found that this phone is more value on money + high good spec. The thing that might be spoil is battery cannot remove and no external sd card slot. check this link   
8) The phone design is simply the best and its not really heavy. Slim and curve at the backside + sandstone black cover, the feeling in your hand its definitely wotth it. Im not are dealer for the phone but i have strongly recommended bunch of my friend to switch to this when they want to buy/change to new phone. (Sorry for bad grammar)

i m using this phone from last one month. I'd like to share a few  things tht i have found from my usage , 

 
1.first of all, Its a great phone for this price range excellent design and performance.
 
2. Display quality is too good. it has a very good viewing angle and neat colour reproduction.. touch sensityvity is so good and because of the best hardware specs u will feel like butter smooth performance each time u using this device.. in display settings it gives additional options for sunlight enhancement and colour enhancement, enable these options and view the phone in direct sunlight.. its so sharp and clear. best thing about the display, its not getting heat even after heavy usage.. but it gets hot when u record video by keeing ur flash on.. ( only at the top edge, and its normal).. overall u wont get a chance to worry abt ur phone display until and unless u drop the phone
 
3. about the camera- camera quality is not so awesome as expected..if you are a user came from sony xperia, motorola or samsung experiece u wont get compleately satisfied with the picture output.. after all , i personally expected much more neat images from a 13mp sony 6 lens exmor camera.  the dual flash is not so brilliant comparatively with other single flash phones. but stil its great. 
 
the front cam quality is awesome...its really excellent. u wil surely say wow!! i have found these kind of clarity front cam only in apple ipads ..
 
3.external speakers sound quality is is good but the sound quality of the earpiece is muffled.. sometime  its hard to recognise other end sound when attending calls from traffic or the other end person is speaking through the headset. its been said that this phone has 3 mics built in .. but personally i didn't feel any remarkable difference when i play my  voice clip in whatsapp. and most of the time, during calls, friends said they r not able to hear "clearly"what im saying. they can hear , but im telling abt the clarity of voice.. in long duration calls after 20 to 30,min the sound becomes like that u r coverd ur phone with a blanket and speak through it. but once u disconnect the call and call back , again sound wil become clear( its not because of network, cos i m in a very good coverage area and no problems with my other phones )..  
loud speaker quality is superb. 
4. battery life is neat.. for me it gives 8-9 hours of battery life when using internet over wi fi (its like countinues usage) .. i was very much worried abt the battery life cos its 5.5" screen.. but one plus has done their battery so good.. it providing  12 to 13 hrs of battrey life even  while keeping the phone in 3g mobile data on and light use of internet.
 
5.performance wise its  really rocks ..i nevr had any issue in its performance and the phone never heats up while gamming ( i just tried only for testing.dnt know abt long duration game play and higher end games)
 
these are the pros and cons i personally felt in my usage..  and this sound and camera issues i feel like its because of the cyanogen mode rom. i faced  these issues when i tried some  cyanogen and paranoid roms in my other phones too.hopes it may get improved with the one plus one oxygen update.
 
and one more thing if u r buying this one please do buy the original tampered glass screen protector..the  phone is awesome n good but if it falls, display faced down , seriously u wont have a smiling face after u picked up from ground

Updated my OPO this morning with incremental update O5Q.
 
Everything is just the same as there are not supposed to be any visual changes. 
But what's changed is the Equalizer. 
The erstwhile 5band Audio FX has been replaced with a 10band AudioMaxx equalizer. 
The change though is not good at all. 
I have a Sony MDR XB30EX which are praised for its oomph and bass. These sounded AWESOMEEEE with previous Audio FX equalizer. 
Audio FX was so sensitive that effects were audible even with slight tweeking. But the new AudioMaxx EQ seems to be non responsive..as changing settings even to the extremes does not change anything worth noticing. 
The bass is gone. What you hear now is plain flat music. 
I don't know what its gonna sound through other normal earphones.
 
Oneplus you need to fix this. ASAP.

Well guys I have spent 3 weeks with the oneplus one and here is my experience with the phone so far: 
1. Camera is pretty good, although the looks of the camera UI are quite dated. The dual-LED flash is not as powerful as I expected it to be, but still brighter than the sony xperia sp that I had before. 
2. The cyanogenmod user interface is just awesome. I have always been a fan of the stock android interface and the customization options just make it even better. 
2. The preloaded cyanogen gallery app sucks somewhat. I tried selecting the option to edit the photo but no photo editor would open. I ultimately downloaded the Nexus Gallery app from play store and disabled the cyanogen gallery. 
3. The file manager also simply sucks. It doesn't have a cut/paste option. There is a 'copy' option but it simply creates a second copy of the file in the same directory itself. Again I downloaded File Commander app from play store because of this. 
4. Performance of the phone on the default Dalvik runtime and the 'interactive' CPU governor was just average. Several transition effects were stuttery, and basic apps like settings took 2-3 seconds to load (multitasking wasn't an issue though). It felt as if I'm using a moto g with snapdragon 400 instead of a phone with snapdragon 801. I finally changed runtime to ART (via developer options) and set CPU governor to 'performance' to get the performance I expected from a snapdragon 801 (the phone might become a bit unstable by changing runtime but so far my phone rebooted itself only once so such reboots are very rare I guess). 
5. After fiddling with the CPU modes and stuff I'm sure battery life would be a little worse than before but for me it has not been an issue at all. The phone lasts for a day atleast with heavy internet usage, an hour of asphalt 8 and frequent use of whatsapp, instagram and facebook and some 2 hours of listening to music. 
6. The phone does tend to get overheated while charging (after modifying runtime and CPU settings) and temperature goes up to around 42°C but charging speed itself is pretty quick so that is again not an issue. The phone goes from 0-100% in about one and half hour so that is also fast enough.
 
Hope this review helps all everyone out there.

I want to  warn other potential customers about the OnePlus phone which I bought in December 2014 & was using it for about 2 weeks. One issue is several times within this short 2 weeks, the internet connection would just stop working, so I had to turn the phone off for a few minutes & then back on & then it would resume the internet. (I had iphones & android phones before & this problem rarely came up.) Second major issue is their customer service is email only (which takes 1-2 days for then to reply to me). My charger cable became damaged beyond repair. My request email got answered by different reps which gave me inconsistent response & none of them allowed me to buy a new replacement charger cable. Their policy is they only include ONE cable with each phone purchase. The customer cannot buy another cable for whatever reason. Ridiculous policy! Bad customer service is not acceptable.

I got this phone on 8 th December and from Day 1 
 I Just love it. 
 
I'm currently using a #M8   & #Ip5s but still i feel that i have hit a Jackpot of Variety this time.
 
Here's a little unboxing glimpse, review and comparison with other phones which I'm currently using. 
 
I hope it's helpful. 
 
Best things First
 
1)Amazing feel in Hand. Superb build quality and especially the sandstone finish feels so different and elegant. SUPERB gripping.
 
2)Read/write On Phone via Pc is Very fast. 64Gb storage a super +
 
3)Cyanogen has done an excellent job. Super fluid Os.
 
4)Cyanogen Theme store is so amazing that everyday i feel i have a new phone( s/w wise) due to immense ablity of the theme engine to modify the os. 
U name the Company/interface they have on the theme store. Max are paid but still they all are Super. Just search play store by typing Cyanogen Themes and u have 100's.
 
5) Screen Recorder is great. So easy to make demos which wud be only possible after rooting other phones.
 
6)Ultra Fast! SMOOTH Animations, Great Transitions Overall great Ui and Change able whenever you want.
 
7)sound quality in Headphones is Top Notch. Audio engine is super guys. The bass boost to surround aound & all the effects actually work. What a sound chip.
 
8)Customizable to the limit. Impossible is nothing for OPO
 
9)Love the option to switch between On screen buttons and Hardware Keys. Never seen anything like this
 
10)Amazing Battery life, with heavy usage i am easily getting a days backup. With nearly 5hr screen on time and 3hr voice calls.
 
11)It feels so light in the hand. The weight balancing done by opo is simply superb and mind blowing. Being a 5.5" phone u dont feel the weight.
 
Updated on 12/12/14
 
12)The best thing it has both Micro /nano sim adapters... So actually from whichever phone u are porting u dont need to worry about the Sim card. 
 
The Good /Average things
 
1)The camera is not top notch. I personally use the M8 and am a fan of it never used a better camera/camera ui. 
But this in any case does not mean that is not good but certainly not the best.
 
2)Sound via speakers sometimes crackles at max volume.
 
3)Screen is very good but comparing it to My Samsung tab s 8.4"/M8 the color depth and saturation is not equivalent. 
For a normal user who is not very particular this is still an excellent screen with great pixel density.
 
4)Cyanogens gallery app cud have been better. Not bad but Dil Maange More Type of feeling and expectation from cyanogen. Wink.
 
I think this is enough. But seriously guys its one hell of a killer. From looks to performance its a power house.
 
Go for it u wont regret it and will actually realise that at such a low cost such devices can be made. And how had we been fooled from such a long time.

I did switch from iPhone a month ago and was dreading the change over. Surprisingly it was basic as I'm using Spotify for all my music, gave me a chance to clear my contacts and customising my device has been a blast, can't put it down. To be realistic, you won't find a perfect phone no matter what you buy. Ive always owned iphones. At times they've had dicky buttons, lagging, freezing, rebooting themselves, the list goes on. For a new company's attempt at cracking the smartphone market this phone ticks all the boxes. In saying that i've had a couple of small glitches but getting them sorted has been a breeze if you're prepared to problem solve and research the answers. I got the phone shipped to Australia as they aren't available here. For just over $400 outright if it fails me in a year I couldn't care. Bang for buck

I've had the OnePlus 1 since 9/30. I like a lot of things about the OPO: customizability, battery life, screen size/resolution; but the entire system is buggier than my Nexus 5. The OPO is also laggy compared to the Nexus. The screen sensitivity is a major problem... I have to tap 2, 3 or 4 times to get a click to register. The lag between "clicking" and the next screen loading is painful. The delay between a registered "click" and the readiness to accept another "click" is frustrating. (e.g. I click the "Messages" icon, and the screen opens, I quickly tap on a conversation, but the click never registers. I have to give the handset a split second after the screen loads before it'll accept another click. That happens in various applications, and is a huge issue compared to my Nexus 5.) These are issues that are independent of network connectivity. It's going from the lock screen to the home screen. From the home screen to the "Phone" screen. From the tray to open the calculator. Bringing up the keyboard in messaging & email apps. Etc. 
 
Swiping down to open the notification bar and settings menu is dodgy... it'll open, but sometimes slide back closed. Or open halfway and then close again. Then it won't register the next swipe down, and I'll have to swipe 2-3 times to get it to open correctly.
 
Screen orientation/rotation is slow and sometimes locks up on me. Apps crash regularly that have always worked without a glitch on my Nexus 5. While on the lock screen yesterday, I couldn't enter any characters because there was a constant stream of numbers being input while the phone was sitting untouched on my desk. I tried to hit "back," the power button, "enter," all to no avail. I had to wait about 2 minutes for the stream of numbers to stop. Another time while on lock screen, the keypad refused to accept any of my touches while attempting to enter my security code. Result: I couldn't unlock the phone for 5 minutes until it started working again. 
 
There's great potential, but the entire experience feels like it's in beta and not completely solid or ready for general release. In contrast, I've had a Nexus 4 and a Nexus 5, and the interface with those was consistent and rock-solid.

I have had my OnePlus One handset now for just over a week and I must say, I LOVE IT! Why? well here's the story.
 
I have always had a fascination about mobile/cellular technology and have had too many handsets than I'd care to remember.  I have spent quite a few years working in the mobile retail industry too, so I know the odd thing or two about them.
 
In the Western part of the world, we tend to be cautious of things that come from Asia, in particular from China. Why? Well that's another discussion altogether.  But even people from that part of the world even tend to stay clear.  Is this a fair assumption? I think so.  Is it fair to the companies in China? I don't think it is.
 
From out of nowhere, (well, OPPO to be precise) a company called OnePlus hit the headlines claiming to be the 'Flagship Killer'.  Could this be so?  I mean, who are they? What's their game?
 
Having read about the One, I liked the look of the specs and looked for comparisons.  I liked the look of the LG G3 and was contemplating that on a £33 monthly tariff on the 3 network. (If you haven't guessed by using the pound sterling sign, I'm in the UK)  This would have gotten me 600 minutes, Unlimited Text, free calls to 0800 number and all you can eat data and tied into a 24 month contract.
 
I thought this was ok but though I would look at their sim only plans.  The above tariff was plentiful for me, 600 minutes equates to 10 hours per month talk time.  I'm a guy, I don't talk on the phone that much!  I didn't really want to be tied into a contract if I could help it so looked at their 1 month rolling plans.  There is was the above tariff, £21 a month, can quit at any time.  So I worked the difference out between that and the first tariff which, accounted for a £288 price difference over the 2 years which isn't that bad considering the LG G3 is worth £500 to buy sim free.
 
I looked around to see what that £288 could buy and wasn't amused to the lack of choice.  I wanted an all singing/all dancing handset.  Nothing took my fancy!
 
By this time, I completely forgot that I had registered my interest into the OnePlus One handset until, one day late in August I was sent an invite to buy the handset.  So I looked up the specs again but since other people had been getting their handsets I read a few of the reviews on there.  I took into account that one only hears negative comments about products.  We, as human beings are quick to raise a grievance but extremely slow to show our appreciation.
 
I was a bit hesitant when I read about a yellow band, yet relieved to hear there was a work around (not fix) but a work around where you could blend the colours on the screen.  I decided there and then I'll order the handset.
 
As soon as I ordered I joined in on the forums (forums.oneplus.net) where I could converse with other users hear their experience and to help new forum members as time went on.
 
The Camera is astonishing, it's not cheap by all means, it has Sony's latest Exmor R sensor and takes stunning images and video recordings. I love being able to film my dog being ditzy, chasing her tail or running after a ball in slow motion, filming at 120fps in 720.  
 
The battery is great for a phone this powerful.  I get 2 days out of it with constant use, bluetooth, wifi, gps, constant checking of emails from the servers, full screen brightness all switched on which I think is pretty impressive.
 
The speakers....Well, I don't have to plug in any external speakers to hear my music.  I can now leave my handset in the living room whilst I'm working away in the kitchen.  This is two rooms away and I can hear the sound crystal clear.  One of my previous handsets was another One, the HTC One, again, this was a great handset but boy, the OnePlus One knocks the HTC out of the water!
 
This handset, by far, is the best handset I have EVER owned.  I believe when they say, It certainly IS a flagship killer.  Like they've said to Apple "Welcome to the PLUS family" :)
 
For half the price of a 'flagship' I have certainly got the best handset going!

To claim under warranty, simply go to the OnePlus website (link below) and submit your claim.
 
Please bear in mind that they are a new company, they are still evolving, they still have a lot of queries from customers wanting the handset.  The claim may take a little while to process. (No, I don't work for OP)
